oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Macedonia Baptist Church: cornerstone
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of church cornerstone inlaid into brick. Inscription reads, "Macedonia Baptist Church; Newport, Tennessee; Established 1898 - Rebuilt 1978; Pastor, Rev. C. J. Mize; Deacons: Virgil Dirl, Joe Carr, Jerry Goodrum, William Knox, Harold Carr, Billy Davis; Trustees: Robert Mills, James Goodrum, Dennis Swagerty, Roland Dykes; Sarah D. Brabson, Clerk." Smaller cornerstone, located beneath the larger one, reads, "Macedonia Baptist Church, Completed 1898."

Established in 1898, Macedonia Baptist Church resides in Newport, Tennessee. In 1978, the current building on White Oak Avenue was built under the pastorate of Reverend C. J. Mize. At the time of fieldwork, James C. Billings served as pastor.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Baptist church buildings
